result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa A Zemel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).
  • Computer Message-Threaten/Injury or Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.0125(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
It is the court's intention that the Department of Corrections can take 25% from all money received for the benefit of the inmate while he is incarcerated to be applied to restitution owing to the victim.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

AMENDED 05-13-2016 TO INCLUDE NAME/ADDRESS OF VICTIM FOR RESTITUTION PURPOSES

Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent. May not frequent any taverns, bars or liquor stored.   Take all medications as prescribed.    Defendant is to sign medical release to allow agent access to medical and prescription records.   No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).   Do not drive unless properly licensed and must have permission of agent.   Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on May 10, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Melissa A Zemel in court with attorney Jamie J LaVora.  Defendant Melissa A Zemel in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.  Reports have been received and reviewed.  Def. withraws plea of NGI and enters a plea of NC.   PLQ filed  State offers on a Plea to cts. 1 and 3 and  DRI balance of charges.  State will not issue on new referral.    Follow recommendation of PSI.  Judge conducts the plea colloquey.  
Judge accepts the NC plea and finds the def. G of counts 1 and 3.  

BTC:  PSI ordered.

bond motion has been filed by the defense.  Def. requests a lower bond.  She would live at home and would like to go to doctor appointments and therapy appointments and be on the correct medications.  Monitoring could be set up.  $10,000C bond is requested.
State presents bond argument.  Mother appears and answers questions by the court.

BTC: Bond modifieded to $10,000C and $90,000 Cosigned bond with mother, Mary Zemel  dob 2/28/48  GPS monitoring. no electronic devices.  remain home except for attorney visits, dr. visits and counseling visits.  ZCI to monitor.  Monitor must be installed before relase.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 10:00 am.
